title: Subsistence economy: Gathering
definition: Group's dependence upon gathering of terrestrial plants, relative to other subsistence activities.
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

title: Subsistence economy: Hunting
definition: Group's dependence upon hunting of terrestrial animals, relative to other subsistence activities
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

title: Subsistence economy: Fishing
definition: Group's dependence upon fishing of aquatic organisms, relative to other subsistence activities
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

title: Subsistence economy: Most important activity
definition: Subsistence activity that provides the majority of a group's nutritional intake (hunting, gathering, or fishing)
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) pp. 117, 312

title: Subsistence economy: Deviation from HGF at documentation
definition: Character of a group's subsistence economy at the time of documentation (i.e., was susbsistence truly through hunting, gathering, fishing, only?). Groups are coded as either "normal" or "suspect".
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 244

title: Population of ethnic group
definition: Total number of persons to whom the the ethnographic description applies
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

title: Area occupied by ethnic group (square km)
definition: Ethnographers' estimates of the total land area occupied by the group, in square kilometers
changes: Binford provided estimates in units of '100 square km,' rather than 'square km'
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

title: Population density (persons per square km)
definition: Population of ethnic group divided by area occupied by ethnic group (persons per square km)
changes: Binford provided estimates in 'person per 100 square km' rather than in 'persons per square km'
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

title: Mobility of group
definition: Is the population mobile or sedentary?
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

category: Population, Demography, Subsistence, Community organization, Settlement
title: Size of smallest group that regularly cooperates for subsistence
definition: Mean size of the mobile consumer unit that camps together during the most dispersed phase of the settlement cycle. For sedentary groups, the entry indicates the size of the mobile task group operating out of a relatively permanent settlement, as in the case of family units moving together in a ‘walkabout’ strategy during some season of the year. (Binford's "GRP1").
source: Binford (2001) Tables 5.01 and 8.01; variable 'GROUP1' (Table 5.01) or 'MOST DISPERSED' (Table 8.01)
changes: In cases where tables 5.01 and 8.01 provided different values for the same society, we adopted the value from table 8.01 because data points in that table were tagged with their specific reference (including page numbers). These cases are flagged by a comment in the "Comments" field.
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) pp. 117, 143, 236, 244

title: Size of village or camp when population most aggregated
definition: Mean size of the consumer group that regularly camps together during the most aggregated phase of the yearly economic cycles (applies to groups that are mobile, moving entire population from camp to camp as subsistence activities are carried out). For sedentary groups, this is village size.  (Binford's "GRP2").
source: Binford (2001) Tables 5.01 and 8.01; variable 'GROUP2' (Table 5.01) or 'MOST AGGREGATED' (Table 8.01)
changes: In cases where tables 5.01 and 8.01 provided different values for the same society, we adopted the value from table 8.01 because data points in that table were tagged with their specific reference (including page numbers). These cases are flagged by a comment in the "Comments" field.
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) pp. 117, 144, 237, 244

title: Size of periodic regional aggregations
definition: Mean size of multigroup encampments that may aggregate periodically, but not necessarily annually, for immediate subsistence-related activities. (Binford's "GRP3").
source: Binford (2001) Tables 5.01 and 8.01; variable 'GROUP3' (Table 5.01) or 'PERIODIC REGIONAL AGGREGATIONS' (Table 8.01)
changes: In cases where tables 5.01 and 8.01 provided different values for the same society, we adopted the value from table 8.01 because data points in that table were tagged with their specific reference (including page numbers). These cases are flagged by a comment in the "Comments" field.
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) pp. 117, 145, 244

title: Number of moves per year
definition: Number of moves per year, with 0 moves indicating that society is sedentary
source: Binford (2001) Tables 5.01 and 8.04.; variable 'NOMOV' (Table 5.01) or 'NUMBER OF MOVES PER YEAR' (Table 8.01)
changes: In cases where tables 5.01 and 8.04 provided different values for the same society, we adopted the value from table 8.04 because data points in that table were tagged with their specific reference (including page numbers). These cases are flagged by a comment in the "Comments" field.
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 117

title: Distance moved per year (km)
definition: Total distance moved between camps/settlements in a year. A distance of 0 indicates society is sedentary.
source: Binford (2001) Tables 5.01 and 8.04.; variable 'DISMOV' (Table 5.01) or 'DISTANCE MOVED PER YEAR' (Table 8.01)
changes: In cases where tables 5.01 and 8.04 provided different values for the same society, we adopted the value from table 8.04 because data points in that table were tagged with their specific reference (including page numbers). These cases are flagged by a comment in the "Comments" field. Note that Binford's table 8.04 provides estimates in miles rather than in km.
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) pp. 117, 150

title: Household size
definition: Number of persons residing in a single structure

title: Family size
definition: Number of persons per family

title: Domestic organization
definition: The prevailing form of domestic or familial organization
source: Binford (2001) Table 8.08; variable 'HOUSEHOLD TYPE' (converted to numeric codes following Gray (1999))

title: Marital composition: monogamy and polygamy
definition: Marital composition of family units, regardless of whether families live as independent nuclear units or as part of larger extended families
source: Binford (2001) Table 8.08; variable 'HOUSEHOLD TYPE' (converted to numeric codes following Gray (1999))

title: Polygyny
definition: Percentage of males with more than one wife

title: Age of males at first marriage
definition: Mean age (in years) of males at first marriage
source: Binford (2001) Table 8.07; variable 'AGE AT MARRIAGE - MALE'

title: Age of females at first marriage
definition: Mean age (in years) of females at first marriage
source: Binford (2001) Table 8.07; variable 'AGE AT MARRIAGE - FEMALE'

title: Mean household size (in small subsistence groups)
definition: An estimate of mean household size based on the following calculation: number of persons in smallest group that regularly cooperates for subsistence, divided by number of households in one of these groups
notes: Code and variable definitions from Binford and Johnson (2006)

title: Mean family size (in small subsistence groups)
definition: An estimate of mean family size based on the following calculation: number of persons in smallest group that regularly cooperates for subsistence, divided by number of married men in group
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p.286 and Binford and Johnson (2006)

title: Mean household size (in villages or large camps)
definition: An estimate of mean household size based on the following calculation: number of persons per settlement (i.e., village or camp at time of year when population is most aggregated), divided by number of households per settlement

title: Mean family size (in villages or large camps)
definition: Mean family size calculated as: number of persons per settlement (i.e., village or camp at time of year when population is most aggregated), divided by number of married men per settlement.

title: Number of families per household
definition: Mean number of families per household

title: Jurisdictional hierarchy of local community
definition: Political complexity at level of local community
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 244, caption to fig. 8.02; p.338, caption to Fig 9.06

title: Political relationship to neighbouring groups
definition: Political and economic position of the group relative to other groups in the region
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 404

title: Type of social class distinction
definition: Type of social class distinction
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 396

title: Perogatives of leadership
definition: Perogatives of leadership, regardless of the types of leadership present in the group
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p.338, caption to Fig 9.06

title: Use of money
definition: Presence or absence of use of money within the society
notes: Code and variable definitions from Binford and Johnson (2006)

title: Economic specialization
definition: Whether there is economic role specialization beyond simple age and gender differences
notes: More detail on variable in Binford (2001) p. 333, but no code definitions; division of labor discussed briefly on p. 244; code definitions from Binford and Johnson (2006)

title: Community marriage organization
definition: The prevalence of local endogamy, agamy, and exogamy coded together with the presence or absence of localized kin groups. Can be interpreted as ordinal measure of endogamy.
notes: Code and variable definitions from Binford and Johnson (2006)

title: Community facilities
definition: The functions and properties of structures with specific community-wide functions. These are not residences, nor are they multifunctional residences.
notes: Code and variable definitions from Binford and Johnson (2006)

title: Ownership of resource locations
definition: Ownership of resource locations
notes: Code definitions somewhat ambiguous, see Binford (2001) p. 426, caption to Fig. 11.17

title: System state: typology of society's political organization
definition: Variable represents a combination of data relating to leadership, internal differentiation of leadership status, associated roles relative to participation in decision making, and the exercise of power within the society. According to Binford (2001) these include some of the criteria used in "more thoughtful evolutionary classifications," such as ones by Fried (1967) and Jonson and Earle (1987).
notes: More detail on code definitions and variable in Binford (2001) p. 345; Codes given in caption for figure 9.02.

title: Height (male, mm)
definition: Stature (mm) - Male
source: Binford (2001) Table 6.03; variable 'STATURE (CM*) - MALE' (*should be mm)

title: Height (female, mm)
definition: Stature (mm) - Female
source: Binford (2001) Table 6.03; variable 'STATURE (CM*) - FEMALE' (*should be mm)

title: Weight (male, kg)
definition: Weight (kg) - Male

title: Weight (female, kg)
definition: Weight (kg) - Female
